Question: What is the name of your SD-WAN transformation project?
Guidance: Provide internal project reference name

Question: Who is the primary stakeholder for this WAN modernization?
Guidance: Name, role, and decision-making authority
Notes: Main point of contact and decision authority

Question: What challenges are driving SD-WAN adoption?
Guidance: Common challenges: High MPLS costs, Insufficient bandwidth, Slow site deployment, Poor cloud application performance, Inflexible WAN, Complex management
Notes: Primary business driver for SD-WAN investment

Question: What is your current WAN architecture?
Guidance: Describe: MPLS circuits, Internet circuits, Hub-and-spoke topology, Point-to-point links, VPN overlay

Question: What are your primary goals for SD-WAN?
Guidance: Common goals: Reduce WAN costs, Increase bandwidth, Accelerate site deployment, Optimize cloud apps, Simplify management, Improve resilience

Question: How will you measure SD-WAN success?
Guidance: Define KPIs: Cost savings %, Bandwidth increase, Site deployment time, Application performance SLA, WAN uptime %

Question: What is your expected timeline for SD-WAN deployment?
Guidance: Typical ranges: 0-6 months pilot, 6-12 months full deployment, 12-24 months phased migration

Question: What is your approved budget range for SD-WAN?
Guidance: Common ranges: $250K-500K, $500K-1M, $1M-3M, $3M+. Include hardware, circuits, software, services

Question: What is your cloud adoption strategy?
Guidance: Strategy: Cloud-first SaaS adoption, Cloud migration in progress, Hybrid cloud, On-prem only, Multi-cloud

Question: When do current MPLS contracts expire?
Guidance: Contract status: Month-to-month, Expiring in 6 months, Expiring in 12 months, Long-term contract (2+ years), No MPLS

Question: How many branch office sites do you have?
Notes: Site count drives router quantity and licensing

Question: What is your expected site growth over 3 years?
Guidance: Growth: Current site count, projected additions per year, acquisitions expected

Question: How would you categorize your sites?
Guidance: Categories: Large branches (100+ users), Medium branches (25-100 users), Small branches (<25 users), Retail/kiosks, Remote workers

Question: What are your current annual WAN circuit costs?
Guidance: Costs: MPLS cost per site, Total annual MPLS spend, Internet circuit costs, Other WAN expenses
Notes: ROI baseline for cost savings analysis

Question: What bandwidth does each site currently have?
Guidance: Bandwidth: MPLS (typical 5-20 Mbps), Internet (if dual-circuit), Bandwidth adequacy assessment

Question: What bandwidth do sites need with SD-WAN?
Guidance: Requirements: 50 Mbps, 100 Mbps, 250 Mbps, 500+ Mbps, Varies by site size

Question: What WAN circuit types are available at your sites?
Guidance: Circuits: Fiber (DIA), Cable broadband, DSL, Fixed wireless, LTE/5G, Starlink satellite

Question: What WAN topology do you prefer?
Guidance: Topology: Dual circuits per site (active-active), Broadband primary + LTE backup, Single circuit (cost-optimized), Mesh (any-to-any)

Question: How many hub sites or data centers do you have?
Guidance: Hub count: 1 data center, 2 data centers (HA), Regional hubs, No central hub (cloud-centric)

Question: What are your primary traffic patterns?
Guidance: Patterns: Branch to data center, Branch to cloud (Office 365 AWS), Branch to branch, Internet breakout

Question: What critical applications use the WAN?
Guidance: Applications: Office 365, Teams/Webex, Salesforce, SAP/ERP, VoIP, Video conferencing, File servers, Custom apps

Question: What application SLA requirements do you have?
Guidance: SLAs: VoIP <100ms latency, Video <150ms, Mission-critical apps <50ms, Best-effort for web browsing

Question: What cloud platforms do you use?
Guidance: Platforms: AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, Oracle Cloud, SaaS only (Office 365 Salesforce), None
Notes: Cloud on-ramp and direct connect requirements

Question: Do you need dedicated cloud connectivity?
Guidance: Options: Cloud on-ramps (Equinix Megaport), VPN to cloud, Public internet only, ExpressRoute/Direct Connect

Question: What routing protocol do you currently use?
Guidance: Protocols: BGP, OSPF, EIGRP, Static routes, None (single circuit)

Question: What QoS and traffic prioritization is needed?
Guidance: QoS: VoIP/video priority, Business-critical apps, Bulk data transfer, Guest internet, Application-based QoS

Question: Do you require multicast support?
Guidance: Multicast use cases: Video distribution, Real-time collaboration, Surveillance cameras, Not required

Question: Do you require IPv6 support?
Guidance: IPv6: Required for all sites, Dual-stack (IPv4+IPv6), IPv4 only, Future requirement

Question: What security controls are required on SD-WAN?
Guidance: Controls: Integrated firewall, IPS/IDS, URL filtering, Malware protection, DDoS mitigation, VPN encryption

Question: What firewall approach do you prefer?
Guidance: Approach: Integrated firewall on SD-WAN routers, Separate firewall appliances, Cloud-delivered firewall (SASE), Umbrella DNS security

Question: What VPN encryption requirements apply?
Guidance: Encryption: IPsec for all WAN traffic, Opportunistic encryption, No encryption (trusted MPLS), Per-application encryption

Question: What is your local internet breakout strategy?
Guidance: Breakout: Direct internet at branches for SaaS, Backhauled to data center, Selective based on application, Cloud proxy (Zscaler Umbrella)

Question: Are you implementing Zero Trust Network Access (ZTNA)?
Guidance: ZTNA: Planned with SD-WAN, Future initiative, Not planned, Already have VPN solution

Question: What compliance standards apply to WAN?
Guidance: Standards: PCI DSS, HIPAA, SOC 2, ISO 27001, NIST 800-53, Federal regulations

Question: Do you require Data Loss Prevention (DLP)?
Guidance: DLP: Integrated DLP on SD-WAN, Cloud DLP service, Not required, Future requirement

Question: What audit and logging requirements apply?
Guidance: Requirements: WAN traffic logs, Security event logs, Policy changes, Performance metrics, SIEM integration, Retention period

Question: How many network engineers support the WAN?
Guidance: Team size: 1-2 engineers, 3-5 engineers, 6-10 engineers, Distributed regional teams

Question: What is your team's SD-WAN experience?
Guidance: Experience: None - new to SD-WAN, Basic understanding, SD-WAN pilot experience, Multi-vendor SD-WAN, Cisco SD-WAN certified

Question: What SD-WAN management model do you prefer?
Guidance: Models: Self-managed vManage, Cisco-managed service, Partner-managed (MSP), Hybrid co-managed

Question: How does SD-WAN integrate with your NOC?
Guidance: NOC: Centralized NOC with monitoring tools, Regional NOCs, Outsourced NOC (MSP), No formal NOC

Question: What network monitoring tools are in use?
Guidance: Tools: SolarWinds, PRTG, Cisco Prime, DNA Center, ThousandEyes, Datadog, Other

Question: What troubleshooting capabilities do you need?
Guidance: Capabilities: Application path visibility, Packet capture, WAN optimization insights, Real-time performance dashboards, Historical trending

Question: What change management processes apply?
Guidance: Processes: CAB approval for policy changes, Maintenance windows, Staged rollout, Emergency change process

Question: What support coverage is required?
Guidance: Support: Business hours (8x5), Extended (24x5), Full (24x7), Cisco TAC, Partner support

Question: How are new sites typically deployed?
Guidance: Deployment: IT visits site, Local technician, Ship-and-install, Zero-touch (plug-and-play)

Question: What DR requirements apply to WAN?
Guidance: DR: Automatic failover to backup circuit, Manual failover, Geographic redundancy, RTO/RPO targets

Question: Who will be the technical lead for this SD-WAN project?
Guidance: Name, role, contact information

Question: What internal resources are available for SD-WAN deployment?
Guidance: List team members, roles, time commitment (hours per week)
Notes: Resource planning and project timeline feasibility

Question: What is your preferred SD-WAN migration approach?
Guidance: Options: Pilot 3-5 sites, Phased regional rollout, Site-by-site replacement, Parallel run with MPLS, Overlay then cutover

Question: Which sites should be in the SD-WAN pilot?
Guidance: Pilot criteria: Low-risk sites, Varied site sizes, Representative applications, Friendly users, IT-staffed locations

Question: What cutover approach do you prefer for each site?
Guidance: Cutover: Hard cutover (immediate), Parallel run (weeks), Gradual migration, Application-by-application, Business hours only

Question: Who handles circuit procurement and installation?
Guidance: Procurement: Internal telecom team, Outsourced to partner, Cisco managed service, Carrier relationship

Question: How should routers be shipped and staged?
Guidance: Shipping: Direct to site, Staged at depot, Pre-configured and shipped, Ship from vendor, Kitting and labeling

Question: Do you want zero-touch provisioning (ZTP)?
Guidance: ZTP: Yes for all sites, Pilot only, Manual config preferred, Hybrid (ZTP for branches manual for hubs)

Question: What training is needed for network team?
Guidance: Training: SD-WAN architecture, vManage operations, Policy configuration, Troubleshooting, Advanced features, Certification prep

Question: What documentation standards apply?
Guidance: Documentation: Architecture diagrams, Policy definitions, Runbooks, Site cutover plans, Troubleshooting guides, As-built documentation

Question: What are your main concerns about SD-WAN deployment?
Guidance: Concerns: Site downtime, Application performance, Circuit availability, Team readiness, Budget overruns, Timeline delays
Notes: Primary implementation concerns and risk factors

Question: What is the impact of site WAN outages?
Guidance: Impact: Revenue loss, Customer impact, Operational disruption, Regulatory issues, Reputational damage

Question: What concerns exist about circuit procurement?
Guidance: Concerns: Lead times (60-120 days), Availability at remote sites, Carrier reliability, Contract lock-in, Cost variability

Question: What concerns exist about application performance?
Guidance: Concerns: VoIP quality degradation, Video conferencing issues, ERP responsiveness, Database performance, User experience

Question: What skill gaps exist for supporting SD-WAN?
Guidance: Skill gaps: SD-WAN architecture, vManage operations, Application-aware routing, Troubleshooting, Security integration, Cloud connectivity

Question: What external dependencies exist for this project?
Guidance: Dependencies: MPLS contract expirations, Circuit installations, Budget approvals, M&A activity, Other IT projects, Vendor availability
Notes: Project dependencies and critical path items

Question: What constraints must the SD-WAN solution work within?
Guidance: Constraints: Budget limits, Timeline, MPLS contract lock-in, Circuit availability, Organizational policies, Skill availability
